headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: On 'Having It All' (or Some), and Cracks at NBC News

docs.abstract: Also, Facebook will let users opt out of becoming part of advertisements, and a promotional tie-in between "Madagascar 3″ and a children's medication draws fire.
docs.snippet: Also, Facebook will let users opt out of becoming part of advertisements, and a promotional tie-in between "Madagascar 3″ and a children's medication draws fire.

headline.main: Awaiting the Supreme Court's Health Care Ruling

docs.abstract: The lack of a clear legal consensus on the underlying issues of the health care act may pave the way for the Supreme Court to rule based on ideology.
docs.snippet: The lack of a clear legal consensus on the underlying issues of the health care act may pave the way for the Supreme Court to rule based on ideology.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal government has distributed at least $13.7 billion to date to various government and private groups as part of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, the federal health care law passed in 2010.

docs.lead_paragraph: Merger talks between two of New York City’s biggest hospital systems — NYU Langone Medical Center and Continuum Health Partners — broke down abruptly after Continuum got a competing offer, officials said.

headline.seo: Hospital Systems’ Merger Talks Collapse as Mount Sinai Steps In
headline.main: Hospital Systems’ Merger Talks Collapse as New Suitor, Mount Sinai, Steps In
headline.print_headline: Hospital Systems’ Merger Talks Collapse as New Suitor, Mount Sinai, Steps In

docs.abstract: Merger talks between two of New York City’s biggest hospital systems, NYU Langone Medical Center and Continuum Health Partners, abruptly break off as Mount Sinai Medical Center makes a competing offer for Continuum; Mount Sinai has the most to lose from the possible merger, which would create a formidable rival and hurt its clinical, research and academic initiatives.
docs.snippet: Merger talks between two of New York City’s biggest hospital systems — NYU Langone Medical Center and Continuum Health Partners — broke down abruptly after Continuum got a competing offer, officials said.

keywords.value: New York University Langone Medical Center
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: As the Supreme Court decides whether to uphold the Affordable Care Act’s individual mandate, insurers are repositioning themselves as consumer-friendly health care companies.

headline.seo: Insurance Companies Are Trying to Soften Their Image
headline.main: Insurers Seek to Soften Their Image, No Matter How Court Rules on Health Act
headline.print_headline: Insurers Seek to Soften Their Image, No Matter How Court Rules on Health Act

docs.abstract: Insurers, preparing for a Supreme Court ruling on the Affordable Care Act, are repositioning themselves as consumer-friendly health care companies; ruling upholding the law would expand the market for insurance, allowing companies to sell directly to millions of uninsured Americans; insurers intend to press forward with their strategy even if the law's insurance mandate is struck down.
docs.snippet: As the Supreme Court decides whether to uphold the Affordable Care Act’s individual mandate, insurers are repositioning themselves as consumer-friendly health care companies.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: It is unclear what would happen to the money for a host of programs if the Affordable Care Act is overturned.

headline.seo: Billions of Dollars in Play Over Health Care Law
headline.main: Billions of Dollars Are in Play Over Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Billions of Dollars in Play Over Health Care Law

docs.abstract: Tens of billions of dollars in federal money appropriated for a host of other provisions in the Obama administration's health care law could vanish if the Supreme Court decides to overturn the entire law; largest share of future spending, some $1 trillion, is expected to pay for expanding coverage, but the law also calls for significant sums to be spent over the next decade on other initiatives aimed at improving the nation’s health care system.
docs.snippet: It is unclear what would happen to the money for a host of programs if the Affordable Care Act is overturned.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: If its major provisions take effect, the Affordable Care Act would prohibit insurers from turning people away or charging them more because they are sick.

headline.main: Those Already Ill Have High Stake in Health Ruling
headline.print_headline: For Those Already Ill, Huge Stake in Court’s Ruling on Health Care Law

docs.abstract: No other group of Americans faces higher stakes in the impending Supreme Court ruling on the Affordable Care Act than those with pre-existing conditions, who are guaranteed coverage under the law.
docs.snippet: If its major provisions take effect, the Affordable Care Act would prohibit insurers from turning people away or charging them more because they are sick.

docs.lead_paragraph: Merger talks between two of New York City's biggest hospital systems -- NYU Langone Medical Center and Continuum Health Partners -- broke down abruptly on Thursday after Continuum got a competing offer, officials said. The offer came from Mount Sinai Medical Center, which, like NYU, is an academic medical center with a prestigious medical school.
